title: Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi return to the Champions League eyeing a century of goals
text:
TON TWINS Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi return to the Champions League eyeing a century of goals 
Barcelona's Argentine maestro faces PSG and Real Madrid star meets Napoli as each nears landmark total in top competition By DAVE KIDD Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments THE Ballon d’Or Brothers are back — and they both have 100 Champions League goals in their sights. 
Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi return to action in the world’s premier club competition over the next two nights and both could reach their century during the knockout stages. Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi have set all sorts of Euro goal records 
Barcelona ’s Argentine maestro Messi faces Paris Saint-Germain tonight with 93 Champions League goals to his name. 
Keep up to date with ALL the football gossip and transfers 
And Real Madrid ’s Portuguese Galactico Ronaldo takes on Napoli in the Bernabeu tomorrow on top of the pile with 95. 
An indication of the magnitude of their achievements is that just two other men — Raul and Ruud van Nistelrooy — have ever scored more than 50 goals in the competition, the pair having bagged 71 and 56 respectively. 
And those two were specialist goal poachers. Messi and Ronaldo are so much more. 
Messi has notched a record seven Champions League hat-tricks — including trebles against Manchester City and Celtic this season. 
So after netting ten goals in this season’s group stage, he could challenge Ronaldo’s record of 17 in a single season, which was set three years ago as the Madrid giants won the tenth of their 11 European crowns. 
If their goalscoring stats are jaw-dropping, then Ronaldo and Messi also rank highly in the list of Champions League assists. EPA Barca superstar Lionel Messi needs just seven goals to reach his Euro century EPA Real legend Ronaldo is the top Champions League scorer with 95 goals 
The supposedly “greedy” Ron is joint top with 30, while Messi stands third with 24. And raw data does not do either man justice — the majesty of Messi in full flow and the supreme athleticism of a rampaging Ronaldo marks both men out as players for the ages. 
It is little surprise that they have carved up World Footballer of the Year honours between them for nine years now. In its various guises, Messi has won five of the awards and Ronaldo four. Getty Images Ronaldo hopes to beat Messi to be the first 100-goal Champions League scorer Getty Images 6 Ronaldo bagged the shootout winner against Atletico in the 2016 final 
It is not hyperbole to suggest we are quite possibly witnessing the two greatest footballers ever to have played the game — a claim which probably only Pele and Diego Maradona can contest. 
Over the past decade, Messi and Ronaldo have carried off three Champions League winner’s medals apiece — and few would look past either of the La Liga giants to lift the famous Old Big Ears trophy again this year. Spanish clubs have won the last SIX European trophies. Real lifted two Champions Leagues and Barca one, while Sevilla have earned a hat-trick of Europa Leagues wins. 
And so English clubs are facing an uphill struggle to make their mark on the latter stages of this competition. Arsenal will take on German champs Bayern Munich in the Allianz Arena tomorrow night. 
The Gunners fell to the Bavarians in 2013 and 2014 and were hammered 5-1 away from home in last season’s group stage. In Carlo Ancelotti, Bayern boast one of only two managers to have won the European Cup three times. Getty Images 6 Argentine ace Messi has been vying with Ronaldo for goal records for a decade 
And the Italian will be targeting European glory with a third different club after two triumphs with AC Milan and one with Real. 
Sevilla, who are challenging Real and Barca for the Spanish title this season, host fallen Premier League champions Leicester next week. 
And Manchester City face a tricky visit from a Monaco side who beat Tottenham twice in the group stages to relegate the Londoners to the Europa League.
